comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: "Grand Duke George Mikhailovich of Russia (Russian: Георгий Михайлович) (23 August 1863 – 28 January 1919) was a son of Grand Duke Michael Nicolaievich of Russia and a first cousin of Emperor Alexander III. He was a General in the Russian army in World War I." en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grand_Duke_George_Mikhailovich_of_R...

comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: "Prince Kan'in Kotohito (閑院宮載仁親王 Kan'in-no-miya Kotohito Shinnō OM?, November 10, 1865 – May 21, 1945), was the sixth head of a cadet branch the Japanese imperial family, and a career army officer who served as Chief of the Imperial Japanese Army General Staff from 1931 to 1940." en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prince_Kan%27in_Kotohito See also comments under

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Russo-Japanese Relations, 1905-17: From Enemies to Allies. By Peter Berton books.google.com/books?id=fLloQH-KN2IC&pg=PA178&l... indicates that the Grand Duke visited Japan in connection with a Russo-Japanese Agreement of 1916. War and National Reinvention: Japan in the Great War, 1914-1919. Page 138. By Frederick R. Dickinson books.google.com/books?id=rrhPyCRpO0gC&pg=PA138&l... indicates that the Grand Duke arrived in Tokyo on Jan 12, 1916.

comment.author: 34904489@N07
comment._content: B-59 and swanq: Thanks for the information on these two gentlemen. We will expand the record to include more information.
